abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Framework for Green
            Growth Development Policy Loan Project for Mexico were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned include: extensive dialogue on the
            prior actions and the desired objectives leads to solid
            programs. The dialogue contributed in part to help the
            Mexican government to enact the Programa Especial de Cambio
            Climático (PECC). Long-standing, comprehensive sector
            dialogue contributed to the ability to deliver immediate
            support. A one-tranche development policy loan (DPL) is an
            adequate instrument to support a countrys sustainable
            growth in the face of short-term financial pressures. A DPL
            can pave the way for many other Bank-financed operations,
            and in turn, those operations enrich the dialogue to develop
            the DPL. Technical support from the Bank is a key to
            reducing risk for the government and helping to advance
            objectives. Inter-institutional coordination is one key to
            enabling a successful program. Permanent dialogue with the
            client helped to identify technical assistance (TA)
            requirements during the implementation of regulations and
            policy framework.
